description: A half-American Indian and half-white teenager evolves into a hardened killer as he tracks down his parents' murderers.
keywords: revenge,couple killed,stabbed with a knife,white indian,nevada territory
name: Nevada Smith

review.name: Miscast McQueen
review.reviewBody: A young man seeks revenge for the brutal murder of his parents. It's generally well made, but can't overcome a big casting flaw. The title character is supposed to be a teen-aged half-breed. Unfortunately, he's played by 36-year-old blonde-haired, blue-eyed McQueen. It's hard to buy when he is repeatedly referred to as a kid and a half-breed. McQueen tries to act young, but acting like a man half his age makes him appear mentally retarded. The film goes on too long, with an extended prison sequence (stangely reminiscent of "Papillon," which McQueen would star in seven years later) that seems out of place in a Western. The impressive cast is chock full of familiar faces.
